###indices and subsets
* for the vectors
```{r}
vals <- seq(2,12,by = 2)
vals
vals[3]
vals[3:5]
vals[c(1,3,6)]
vals[-c(1,3,6)] #pick out the element from the vectors and remain the rest
vals[c(rep(TRUE,3),rep(FALSE,2),TRUE)] #only show the true element
# subsituting  values
vals[4] <- -35
vals
vals[1:2] <- 0
vals

vals <- rnorm(1000)
hist(vals)
vals[vals<0] <-0 #pick up the suitable subset of vector
hist(vals)
two_sds <- vals[vals > 0]
hist(two_sds)
```

* for the matrix
```{r}
mat <- matrix(1:20,ncol = 4)
mat
mat[2,2]
mat[,1]
mat[2,]
mat[2,2] <- 100
mat
mat[4,] <- rep(100,ncol(mat))
mat
colnames(mat) <- c('one','two','three','four')
rownames(mat) <- c('a','b','c','d','e')
mat
mat[,'four']
mat[,'four'] == mat[,4]
mat[,c('one','three')]
mat[,c('one','three')] == mat[,c(1,3)]
mat[-c(1,3),]
mat[-c(1,3),] == mat[c(-1,-3),]
# when you need to subset, remember imput the vector not a single element mat[,-1:2] mat[,-'one'] don't work
```
* for the list
```{r}
mylist <- list(stuff=3,mat=matrix(1:4,nrow=2),morestuff=c('china','japan'),list(5,'bear'))
mylist
mylist[[1]]
mylist$stuff
mylist[[1]] == mylist[['stuff']]
identical(mylist$stuff,mylist[[1]])
mylist$newone <- 'more weird stuff'
mylist[[4]][[1]]
```
* for the data frame
```{r}
head(airquality)
vec <- airquality$Temp
vec[1:10]
new_vec <- airquality[,5]
new_vec[1:10]
avg <- mean(airquality$Wind)
avg
round_wind <- round(airquality$Wind,digits = 1)[1:10]
round_wind
```
